etymologies: early 16th century (denoting a shelf at the side of a fireplace used for heating pans): of unknown origin (compare with hob)

definitions: the central part of a wheel, rotating on or with the axle, and from which the spokes radiate.
shortDefinitions: central part of wheel, rotating on or with axle

definitions: the effective center of an activity, region, or network

examples.text: the city has always been the financial hub of the country
the kitchen was the hub of family life
Denver became a regional economic hub for a large part of the western United States

shortDefinitions: effective centre of activity or network

definitions: a central airport or other transport facility from which many services operate

examples.text: the city's major transportation hub for bus and rail
major hub airports have grown up all over the world
some new flights are being based in cities that are not traditional international hubs

shortDefinitions: central airport or other transport facility
